name: robert tolar haining
blurb: Who am I? Over a 15 year long career (and going!), I have built software, led projects, and managed people for a wide range of companies in the media, commerce, & financial industries in Atlanta and New York City. From startups to Fortune 500 companies, I have been responsible for developing products from conception to production, as well as working within larger teams. While a classically trained, full-stack engineer, my focus over the past decade has been iOS development. In recent years, I have developed a love for managing people and building teams.

subsections.title: General Galactic Corporation
subsections.subtitle: Galactic builds products that are native to the new internet.
descriptions:
Engineer at a startup, where I have worked on many projects, such as:
  • Galactic Camera: a macOS app providing informational layers on top of your existing video conferencing software.
  • Fancy.art: a macOS screensaver and rejected Apple TV app that shows off your NFT collection and those of your favorite wallets.
  • The Watcher: a macOS app that keeps you up to speed on Ethereum prices, as well as recent transactions of wallets you specify. Read up on the tech stack.
  • Stealth project: tba!

subsections.title: Nugget
subsections.subtitle: share and record audio
descriptions: CTO of a startup, where I was responsible for technical strategy and building an iPhone app, a backend Python API, and a MySQL database. With Nugget, you can record your own audio or share audio from around the Internet. Watch a screen capture of Nugget.

subsections.title: PayPal
subsections.subtitle: worldwide online payments system
descriptions: PayPal acquired Modest in 2015, which was rebranded as PayPal Commerce, where I worked for over a year, before being transferred to Venmo.

subsections.title: Venmo
subsections.subtitle: mobile payment service
descriptions: iOS Engineer for a little over a year before becoming a People Manager, where I have been managing iOS engineers on the App Experience team.

subsections.title: Braintree
subsections.subtitle: payment service provider
descriptions: iOS Engineer on the PayPal Commerce team, which continued work on the Modest product.

subsections.title: Modest
subsections.subtitle: retail solutions for mobile devices / startup
descriptions: iOS Engineer on a small team where I built an SDK that enabled retailers to launch and support mobile commerce apps.

subsections.title: Digg
subsections.subtitle: online news aggregator / startup
descriptions: iOS engineer on the team that acquired the digg brand & launched an editorially based news curation service and an RSS reader. I invented a feature that detects ambient light to determine whether to switch to a 'dark mode'.

subsections.title: News.me
subsections.subtitle: personalized mobile news aggregator / startup
descriptions: iOS engineer on a small team that built a personalized news aggregator that pulls articles your friends post on their Twitter & Facebook feeds. I invented a novel feature called Paperboy, which uses geofencing to trigger news updates.

subsections.title: Condé Nast Publications
subsections.subtitle: magazine and mass media company
descriptions: Tech lead for the Interactive Product Group. We built Idea Flight, which enabled users to deliver presentations, documents, & designs across multiple iPads in a room.

Mobile tech lead for several award-winning iOS apps, including:
  • Epicurious Recipes & Shopping List: utility for finding great recipes on the go and cooking them in the kitchen.
  • Condé Nast Magazine Platform launched with GQ, Vanity Fair, and Glamour.
  • Wired Product Reviews: research reviews on the go.
  • Postcard by Concierge.com: apply filters to photos, and share them with friends.
Full-stack engineer on a small Special Projects team that built Facebook and MySpace apps.

subsections.title: Cox Newspapers
subsections.subtitle: newspaper company
descriptions:
Full-stack engineer on a small Special Projects team, where I built many projects, including:
  • iEat (sole engineer / creator): Brought each newspaper's restaurants' database into the iPod Classic.
  • Bracket Contest Tool (sole engineer): Enabled newspapers to create NCAA bracket-style tournaments for their readers.
  • Directory Tool (sole engineer): Enabled newspapers to create online directories for their community churches, local businesses, etc.
  • MediaHub (tech lead / creator): Hyperlocal photo-sharing website with a neighborhood-based approach.

• People Management, Agile Development, Team Leader
  • Swift, Objective-C, Cocoa Touch, PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Python, Mongo, Java/J2EE, Oracle, macOS screensavers
  • Cross-departmental relationships
  • Product ideation
